cards.question: Which of the following IP address ranges belong to Class A?
Which of the following IP address ranges belong to Class B?
Which of the following IP address ranges belong to Class C?
What would be the subnet mask for a Class C network?
Given the network 172.16.0.0, what are the network and broadcast addresses for a Class B network?
What does Unicast mean in networking?
options: Unicast sends data to a group of hosts.
Unicast sends data to all devices.
Unicast sends data to one specific host.
Unicast sends data to one specific device in a broadcast group.
answer: Unicast sends data to one specific host.

cards.question: What does Broadcast mean in networking?
options: Broadcast sends data to one specific host.
Broadcast sends data to all devices on the network.
Broadcast sends data to a group of hosts.
Broadcast sends data to a specific range of IP addresses.
answer: Broadcast sends data to all devices on the network.

cards.question: What does Multicast mean in networking?
options: Multicast sends data to one specific host.
Multicast sends data to all devices on the network.
Multicast sends data to a group of hosts.
Multicast sends data to a random set of devices.
answer: Multicast sends data to a group of hosts.

cards.question: Is the IP address 172.11.0.0 valid for a Class B network?
Is the IP address 192.168.1.1 valid for a Class C network?
Is the IP address 172.20.0.0 valid for a Class B network?
If an IP address is in the range 10.1.1.1 to 10.255.255.255, is it considered an internal (private) IP address?
